item.title: 5 Books That Will Inspire You To Never Give Up On Your Dreams
item.description:
5 Books That Will Inspire You To Never Give Up On Your Dreams

I am an avid reader. I read because there is so much incredible material out there to learn from, but I also read to stay inspired. In the same way movies and YouTube montages and podcasts inspire, books can have a tremendous impact on the way we see the world--and what we believe is "achievable."

item.title: Species of Organizations
item.description:
Species of Organizations

14 April 2016 There are species of organizations just as there are species of animals. Don't mix them up. A bear is not a beaver; one winters in caves, the other in wooden structures they build for themselves. Hospitals are not factories; advertising agencies are not fast food companies.

item.title: The future of business is that the customer is the labor and the capital
item.description:
The future of business is that the customer is the labor and the capital

There is a common misunderstanding about the coming automated economy that may destroy us all. Most people in business and finance (and most people, frankly) think that the new economy (of artificial intelligence and autonomous machines) is like the old economy: satisfying customers' needs for products and services. That's just not so.

item.title: World's biggest startup? Samsung to reform corporate culture
item.description:
World's biggest startup? Samsung to reform corporate culture

SEOUL (By Se Young Lee, Reuters) - Samsung Electronics Co Ltd, the world's biggest maker of smartphones and memory chips, announced on Thursday that it plans to adopt a corporate culture akin to a startup, seeking to become more nimble as growth slows.

item.title: Instinct Can Beat Analytical Thinking
item.description:
Instinct Can Beat Analytical Thinking

Researchers have confronted us in recent years with example after example of how we humans get things wrong when it comes to making decisions. We misunderstand probability, we're myopic, we pay attention to the wrong things, and we just generally mess up.

item.title: Power Suits: How Dressing For Success At Work Can Pay Off
item.description:
Power Suits: How Dressing For Success At Work Can Pay Off

What does it mean to "dress for success"? Certainly not what it meant when a book by that name first came out in 1975. Now, what to wear to work is a murky area that includes a new clothing trend known as "athleisure" - workout wear that might also work for the office.

item.title: The One Big Reason To Every Business Needs Embrace Complexity
item.description:
The One Big Reason To Every Business Needs Embrace Complexity

Managers need to embrace complexity. Not because it will make their enterprise more efficient-it won't-but because that's what will allow them to create maximum value in an increasingly complex marketplace.

item.title: These Are the Most Motivational Books Ever Written
item.description:
These Are the Most Motivational Books Ever Written

Three years ago, I identified the " Top 10 Motivational Books of All Time," but with a twist: I left the No. 1 spot blank and asked Inc.com readers to name their favorite. In hundreds of comments, our readers named almost 300 books, but there were 18 that turned up consistently.
